properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Abbeyard. 
  • There is a bushfire at 10.9Km northwest of Selwyn.
  • The fire is near the East West Buffalo Divide track in the Alpine National Park.
  • Firefighters are currently responding to this fire.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Craigieburn, Donnybrook, Wollert, Woodstock.
  • There is a fire on Summerhill Road, Wollert.
  • The fire is under control. 
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby roads and communities. 
  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 09:07 am on Saturday 03 December. 
There is currently no threat to the community, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do:
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
  • If you are sensitive to smoke or you live with someone who is sensitive to smoke, you should close windows and doors. Turn off heating and cooling systems. 
  • To prevent the smell of smoke entering your home or business, close windows and doors.  
Impacts in your area:
  • Emergency services are monitoring the scene.

This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 05/01/2026 10:00 am or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility:

The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.

  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact the National Relay Service and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Mooroopna North, Shepparton, Shepparton North. 
  • There is a bushfire at Reedy Swamp Rd, Shepparton. 
  • Firefighters are currently responding to this fire and will remain in the area. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • This Community Information replaces the Advice message issued at 4:10pm. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Lurg, Upper Lurg.
  • There is a grassfire at Darktown Road, Lurg that is under control.
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice issued at 2:57 on Sunday, 4 January 2026. 
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
  • Review your fire survival plan.
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are attending to this fire. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 04/01/2026 07:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
